citeinfo.title: Geologic Atlas of Crow Wing County, Minnesota (Part A)

descript.abstract:
A County Geologic Atlas is a systematic study of a county's geologic and ground water resources. Geologic studies include both near-surface deposits and bedrock. Ground water studies include flow systems, aquifer capacity, and ground water chemistry. In some areas sand and gravel deposits, sinkholes, or other features are studied. Interpretation of sensitivity to pollution is also part of an atlas. The information is organized, analyzed, and displayed using geographic information technology.
Most Geologic Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment projects are done in two parts. The Minnesota Geological Survey covers basic geology and creates databases of information such as wells and soil borings in part A. The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) handles hydrogeology and ground water sensitivity layers in Part B. Completion of a project's two parts is staggered: Part A is completed about two years before Part B, compiling information used to create part B. Parts A and B are published and distributed as two separate products.
descript.purpose: County Geologic Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment information is used in planning and environmental protection efforts at all levels of government. Wellhead protection and well-sealing programs are examples of local programs that need geologic and ground water information. The information is also used by businesses and the general public.

timeperd.current: Digital files used to compile the Crow Wing County Geologic Atlas, Part A, were developed 2001-2004. Geologic maps were created based on information available to MGS during the period 2001-2004.

theme.themekey: geoscientificInformation, Bedrock Geology, Surficial Geology, Bedrock Topography, Depth to Bedrock, Drift Thickness,Wells, Mineral Resources, Mine Locations, Aeromagnetic, Cuyuna Range, Surface Topography

place.placekey: Minnesota, MN, Crow Wing County, Cuyuna Range

idinfo.useconst: Credit should be given to the Minnesota Geological Survey for any use of the given digital data in any publication.

citeinfo.title:
C-16, Part A. Geologic Atlas of Crow Wing County, Minnesota. Dale R. Setterholm, Project Manager. 2004. Color. 6 plates. Scales 1:100,000 and 1:200,000. Paper map and report available from MGS Map Sales Office (2609 Territorial Road, St. Paul, Minnesota, 55114, 612-626-2969.)
For a listing of all geologic maps go to the Minnesota Geological Survey website at: http://www.mngs.umn.edu/mgsdocs.html
For a complete listing of MGS State Map Series Maps, Reports, and GIS Data, see http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/708
For other County Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment data see: http://www.mngs.umn.edu/county_atlas/countyatlas.htm
For a listing of the status of the DNR Ground Water Mapping Program, go to: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/waters/groundwater_section/mapping/index.html

procstep.procdesc: Investigations begin with a review of existing information, such as earlier geologic maps, soil maps, and hydrologic reports. Drillers send water well logs to the Minnesota Geological Survey, where they are reviewed, interpreted, and entered into the County Well Index (CWI), an interactive data base of water-well information. Building on the previous data, field studies are conducted to improve the understanding of local geologic and hydrologic conditions. Linework is created based upon the field studies and base data, and digitized. Background GIS data layers such as roads, surface hydrography, township grids, etc., are obtained from various sources. See also metadata files for individual layers.

overview.eaover:
The following are a list of the digital files used in compiling the Crow Wing County Geologic Atlas, 2001-2004.
GEOGRAPHIC INFO ON ALL MAPS: BSAN = annotation cover for lake, city, etc. names (MGS) CITYST = line cover of city roads (MNDOT CITYST) CSAH = line cover of minor roads (MNDOT CSAH) HYLNI = line cover of intermittent streams (MNDOT INTER) HYLNP = line cover of perennial streams (MNDOT PEREN) HWY = line cover of major highways, roads (MNDOT HWY) LKNT = net cover of lakes (MNDOT LAKES) PLS83 = modified line cover of public land survey (MNDOT PLSS)
Data Base: DHPTCW = point cover of exploration drill holes, contains significantly more than shown on map PAPGCW = net cover of county outline (MNDOT COUNTY) SBPT = point cover of MNDOT soil boring locations SEISLOC = point cover of seismic line locations SGPT = point cover of Quaternary borings includes: textural analysis locations TPLN = line cover of surface topography (15 meter intervals) WWPT = point cover of county well index well locations
Bedrock Geology: BGNET = net cover of bedrock and structural geology DHPTCW = point cover of drill holes DIKELN = line cover of dikes GEOLN = line cover of structural features and aeromagnetic linear features MINELN = line cover shown outlines of Cuyuna mines as known SHAFTPTS = point cover of historical mine shaft locations STRPTS = point cover of structure measurements and locations
Surficial Geology: EOLCLPD = poly cover of eolian sand extent, clipped to county bnd GMLNCW = line cover of linear geomorphic features GMPTCW = point cover of glacial flow directions and kames SGPGCW = polygon cover of surficial geology TPLN = line cover of surface topography (15 meter intervals) CWSGSIMP = polygon cover of surficial geology, generalized into 3 broad units
Subsurface Stratigraphy: DEM30 = surface topography integer grid of Crow Wing County from the USGS 30 meter Digital Elevation Model in ASCII format. XSLNS = line cover showing locations of cross sections
Bedrock Topography, Depth to Bedrock and Quaternary Subsurface Geology: BTGD30_I = bedrock topography 30 meter integer grid in ASCII format BTPG = poly cover of bedrock topography elevations DTGD30_I = Depth to Bedrock 30 meter integer grid in ASCII format CWSUBAQ = poly cover of subsurface geology and potential aquifer extents
Mineral Endowment: BGRSNT = polygon cover of mineral endowment related to bedrock geology RSPGCW = polygon cover of surface geology with mineral endowment references in table RSPGDIS = polygon cover of surface geology dissolved on item aggpot (aggregate potential) RSPT = point file of gravel pit locations

stdorder.ordering:
Data download is from the U of M Libraries Digital Conservancy. All GIS data and metadata for the Crow Wing County Geologic Atlas is provided in the zip file C16 Part A Extras.zip. (Supplementary Files)
If you would prefer to have the digital data on DVD, contact MGS Map Sales office at (612) 626-2969.
The direct Digital Conservancy link to PDF map products and GIS data projects (Supplementary Files) for this data set is: http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/58716
If you would like paper copies of the geologic plates; contact the MGS Map Sales office at 612-626-2969 and specify publication County Atlas Series C-16, part A, or County Geologic Atlas of Crow Wing County.
